TopicTitle: Beyond our worlds: Space Engine screenshots gallery

Articles.Content: The procedural generation is generating landscapes, clouds etc when you're by the surface. If you give it a few seconds to catch up, it will smooth out (until it has to generate more landscape), so long as your LOD is set to 1 or lower. (2 will cycle forever)
I am amazed that this "game" run on a computer with a chipset and a celeron , even at (nearly) max graphism (even if the resolition is bad, but am on a laptop, so it isn't important!
I swear I've seen this image IRL before ...

The procedural generation is generating landscapes, clouds etc when you're by the surface. If you give it a few seconds to catch up, it will smooth out (until it has to generate more landscape), so long as your LOD is set to 1 or lower. (2 will cycle forever)

I get that, I just felt that things are a little faster in the clips I see. It might very well be just me

Well, it might be that the clips were rendered using Space Engine's built-in video system: you put SE in "Immediate generation" mode (that is, everything will load/generate and then the frame will show up), and then start a frame-by-frame video recording. What you will see will not be real time, and it will be tricky to move the camera (this is why the Spacecraft camera mode is there), but smooth movements and maximum resolutions are guarenteed.

Give yourself some 30 Gb of free space, and then when you're done, use VirtualDub or RAD Video Tools to assembles all the frames into a single video. You are now ready to edit and send that to youtube, vimeo or whatever !
Looking at all this stuff, I can't decide whether I want KSP to evolve to look like this or Space Engine to evolve to have KSP's level of gameplay.
[redacted. Apparently the forum decided not to show my post until I had been totally convinced it wasn't there and posted it again.]
I don't know what's up with SE lately but it runs like a 1 legged dog on my PC. It did at one point run beautifully but the latest version is terrible even on minimal settings.

More space engine eye candy!

When I load up SE 0.9.4.7, everything except galaxies are invisible. And I mean everything.

How do I fix it?

On Saturday, June 11, 2016 at 11:24 PM, electricpants said:

When I load up SE 0.9.4.7, everything except galaxies are invisible. And I mean everything.

How do I fix it?

Check your settings to see if anythings off. Check the graphic settings first. If not then move your mouse to the lower right (but not bottom right) and a toolbar should appear showing what looks to be galaxies and the lot. Click the ones that are darkened out. It should bring back your celestrial objects. If not then reinstall the simulation.

P.S Your lucky i spotted your comment. This chat has been dead for almost 1.5 years.
